gurmukhi: rudR pRqwp Bey Air b`is ikhUM Air Awn n sIs auTwXo ] kir lY kib sXwm BnY Aiq hI ieh pwien aUpr sIs JukwXo ]
transliteration: Rudra Prataap Bhae Ar(i) Bass(i) Kihoon Ar(i) Aan Na Sees Outhaayo|| Kar(i) Lai Kabi Syaam Bhanai At(i) Hieh Paain Oopar Sees Jhoukaayo||
translation: With the grace of Rudra, all the enemies came under his control and no one raised his head; all of them paid the tax and bowed at his feet;

gurmukhi: BUp n rMck bwq lhI ieh paurK myro eIhY liK pwXo ] paurK BXo BujdMfn ru`dR qy ju`D hI ko bru mwNgn DwXo ]2187]
transliteration: Bhoop Na Ranchak Baat Lahieh Paurakh Mero Eehai Lakh(i) Paayo|| Paurakh Bhyo Bhujdanndan Ruddra Te Juddh Hiko Bar(u) Maanad Dhaayo||2187||
translation: Without understanding the mystery of the grace of Rudra, the king thought that this was due to his power only; thinking about the strength of his arms, he went to Shiva for the grant of the boon of the victory in war.2187.

gurmukhi: mUrK lhXo n Bydu ju`Du chin iSv pY clXo ] kir ibrQw sB Kyd ijv riv qp qwrU qpY ]2188]
transliteration: Moondrakh Lahyo Na Bhed(u) Juddh(u) Chahan(i) Shiv Pai Chadyo|| Kar(i) Birthaa Sabh Khed Jiv Rav(i) Tap Tdaroo Tapai||2188||
translation: Like the blazing sand heated by the sun, that foolish king, without understanding the mystery of his grace, went to Shiva for the grant of the boon of victory in war.2188.
Speech of the king addressed to Shiva:

gurmukhi: sIs invwie kY pRym bFwie kY XO niRp rudR so bYn sunwvY ] jwq ho hau ijh S`qRu pY rudR jU koaU n Awgy qy hwQ auTwvY ]
transliteration: Sees Nivaae Kai Prem Badhaae Kai Yau Nrip Rudra So Bain Sounaavai|| Jaat Ho Hau Jih Shattru Pai Rudra Joo Ko Na Aage Te Haath|| Outhaavai||
translation: Bowing down his head, the king said to Rudra (Shiva) with affection, “Wherever I go, no one raises his hand against me;

gurmukhi: qw qy AXoDn kau hmro kib sXwm khy mnUAw llcwvY ] cwhq ho qum qy bru Awj koaU hmry sMg jUJ mcwvY ]2189]
transliteration: Taa Te Ayodhan Kau Hamro Kabi Syaam Kahe Manooaa Lalchaavai|| Chaahat Ho Toum Te Bar(u) Aaj Ko( i)  Hamre San Joojh Machaavai||2189||
translation: My mind is eager to wage a war and I request you to bestow on me the boon that someone may come to fight with me.”2189.
Speech of Rudra addressed to the king:

gurmukhi: XO suin kY iSv kRoD bFwXO ] XO kih kY iqh bcn sunwXo ] jbY Dujw qumrI igr pir hY ] qbY sUr koaU qum sMig lir hY ]2190]
transliteration: You Soun(i) Kai Shiv Krodh Badhaayau|| Yau Kah(i) Kai Tih Bachanndsounaayo|| Jabai Dhujaa Toumrigir Par(i) Hai|| Tabai Soor Ko( i)  Toum San(i) Lar(i)hai||2190||
translation: Hearing this, Shiva got enraged and said, “When your banner will fall down, then someone will come to fight with you.”2190.

gurmukhi: hÍY kir kRoD jbY iSv jU iqh BUpiq ko iqn bYn sunwXo ] BUp lKXo nh Byd kCU su lKXo icq cwhq ho soaU pwXo ]
transliteration: Hvai Kar(i) Krodh Jabai Shiv Joo Tih Bhoopat(i) Ko Tin Bain Sounaayo|| Bhoop Lakhyo Nah Bhed Kachhodh Su Lakhyo Chit Chaahat Ho Sooo Paayo||
translation: When, in anger, Shiva said this to the king, he did not understand this mystery; he thought that the desired boon had been bestowed upon him;

gurmukhi: bwgy ky BIqr PUl gXo Buj dMfn ko Aiq Ej jnwXo ] XO ds sY Buj sXwm khY Aiq AwnMd so iPr mMdr AwXo ]
transliteration: Baage Ke Bheetar Phool Gado Bhuj Danndan Ko At(i) Oj Janaayo|| Yau Das Sai Bhuj Syaam Kahai At(i) Aanand So Phir Mandar Aayo||2191||
translation: Within his forest, the king got puffed up, considering the strength of his arms; and in this way, Sahasarabahu came back to his home.2191.
